Warm-up (2-3 min)

Terminator review:

Which terminators are usually elidable? (name 2)

(Answers: ku, kei, ku'o, vau — any two)

New Material (5-7 min)

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
ponjo x1 reflects Japanese culture Japanese

Non-Logical vs Logical Connectives

Type Connectives Meaning
Logical .e, je, gi'e Standard and/or
Non-logical joi, ce, ce'o Special groupings

joi — Mass-And (Together as Unit)

la .alis. joi la .bob. cu bevri lo tanxe

Alice-and-Bob (together) carry the box.

(They carry it together, not each separately.)

ce — Set-And (List Members)

lo plise ce lo perli ce lo badna

Apples and pears and bananas (as a set/list).

ce'o — Sequence-And (Ordered)

mi ce'o do ce'o la .tam. cu klama

I, then you, then Tom go (in that order).

Comparison

Expression Meaning
la .alis. .e la .bob. cu klama Alice goes AND Bob goes
la .alis. joi la .bob. cu klama Alice-and-Bob (as unit) go
lo plise ce lo perli {apples, pears} as a set
mi ce'o do me then you (ordered)

Key Point

Non-logical connectives create special groupings: joint action, sets, or sequences.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Use joi

Translate (together as a unit):

  1. Alice and Bob (together) carry the box.
  2. You and I (together) lift the table.
  3. The team (together) wins.
Answers
  1. la .alis. joi la .bob. cu bevri lo tanxe
  2. do joi mi cu lafti lo jubme
  3. lo bende cu jinga (implicit together)

Exercise 2: Use ce and ce'o

Translate:

  1. Apples and oranges (as a set).
  2. First Alice, then Bob, then Tom go.
  3. Red and blue and green (list).
Answers
  1. lo plise ce lo najgja
  2. la .alis. ce'o la .bob. ce'o la .tam. cu klama
  3. lo xunre ce lo blanu ce lo crino

Exercise 3: Compare .e vs joi

What's the difference?

  1. la .alis. .e la .bob. cu klama
  2. la .alis. joi la .bob. cu klama
Answer
  1. Alice goes AND Bob goes (separate actions)
  2. Alice-and-Bob (as a unit) go (joint action)

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "We together carry this." → mi joi do cu bevri ti
  2. "First me, then you." → mi ce'o do
  3. "Dogs and cats and birds." → lo gerku ce lo mlatu ce lo cipni

Summary

You learned non-logical connectives for joint action (joi), sets (ce), and sequences (ce'o).
